1 \defgroup memory-based-session-storage Memory-based Session Storage
2 \ingroup session-storage
3 
4 \details
5 
6 Memory-based session storage is typically used to maintain a high-performance FIXP
7 session when the persisting of a session state and messages to the file system is not
8 required.
9 
10 \section using-memory-based-storage Switching to Memory-based Session Storage
11 
12 To create such a session, the storageType parameter in the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::Session constructor
13 has to be set to the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionStorageType::MemoryBased value.
14 
15 For these purposes, `storageType` parameter
16 of the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::Session constructor is available. Once
17 OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionStorageType::MemoryBased value will be specified
18 as value for the ``storageType` parameter, session-related data will
19 be logged into memory.
20
